item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is an exploration. You start from nothing." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "The bassoon is one of my favorite instruments. It has a medieval aroma, like the days when everything used to sound like that. Some people crave baseball...I find this unfathomable, but I can easily understand why a person could get excited about playing the bassoon." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "I mean, if Beethoven had been killed in a plane crash at twenty-two, the history of music would have been very different. As would the history of aviation, of course." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Robert Graves
item.description: "There's no money in poetry, but there's no poetry in money, either." -- Robert Graves

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Kristi Maxwell
item.description: "History is imported through an I" -- Kristi Maxwell

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "There are no uncontaminated angels" -- Philip Roth

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Kristi Maxwell
item.description: "Living together/ is one move closer/ to living apart" -- Kristi Maxwell

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Larissa Szporluk
item.description: "the girl somewhere, who reads you, whose skin has memorized your life. Nothing stops her fingers; they swim with you at night. " -- Larissa Szporluk

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Larissa Szporluk
item.description: "I grow weird in the field" -- Larissa Szporluk

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Larissa Szporluk
item.description: "Who loves the world? The sleeper does" -- Larissa Szporluk

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Ernest Giles
item.description: "An explorer is an explorer from love, and it is nature, not art, that makes him so." -- Ernest Giles

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Ernest Giles
item.description: "I trust it will be believed that an explorer may be an imaginative as well as a practical creature. " -- Ernest Giles

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Jim Harrison
item.description: "My advice is, do not try to inhabit another's soul. You have your own." -- Jim Harrison

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Jim Harrison
item.description: "The world that used to nurse us now keeps shouting inane instructions. That's why I ran to the woods." -- Jim Harrison

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The tears of the world are a constant quantity. For each one who begins to weep somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh. Let us not then speak ill of our generation, it is not any unhappier than its predecessors." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Charles Simic
item.description: "Making art in America is about saving one's soul." -- Charles Simic

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Marianne Moore
item.description: "... we do not admire what we cannot understand." -- Marianne Moore

item.title: Mark Allen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa
